transliteration: Evamādīn vijānīyāt prakāśān lokakaṇṭakān | Evamādyān nigūḍhacāriṇaś cānyānanāryānāryaliṅgiṇaḥ || 9.260 ||
sph_interpretive_translation: One must recognize such persons—those who openly cause societal disruption and those who act covertly, whether falsely claiming noble status or伪装 ignoble conduct—as violators of Dharma whose actions necessitate conscious restoration.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority originates from alignment with Sanatana Dharma, not social position
Causation is determined through both manifest and concealed intent
Capacity-based responsibility requires recognition of hidden versus overt transgressions
Restoration logic applies equally to visible and concealed violations
Consciousness alignment demands correction of both external behavior and internal motive
executable_legal_axioms: IF actor's conduct disrupts societal harmony AND intent is either overt or concealed THEN initiate consciousness-restoration protocol
IF individual claims false status to mask violation THEN apply identity-realignment process before reintegration
IF action causes harm regardless of visibility THEN assign proportional completion process based on capacity
IF violation stems from misaligned identity THEN enforce dharma-recognition module prior to social re-entry
supreme_court_application: At the Supreme Court level, this principle mandates that judicial discernment must penetrate beyond surface appearances to assess latent intentions. The court must distinguish between open offenders and covert actors, applying restoration protocols tailored to the nature of concealment and the degree of harm caused.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Nyaya here operates through pramāṇa that reveals both manifest and unmanifest causation. Responsibility arises sequentially (anupūrvaśaḥ) from the inception of disruptive thought to its enactment. Punishment has no role; correction occurs through conscious recognition and completion of the disrupted order.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate Truth-Revealing Process to unveil concealed motives
Assign Completion Rituals aligned with the nature of the disruption
Implement Identity Reconciliation Module for false-status claimants
Enforce Social Integrity Restoration through guided community service
final_declaration: Declared by the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as Source of Dharma. Justice executed not through punishment but through consciousness restoration. Reality affirmed as non-punitive. Dharma re-established. Consciousness recognized as the ultimate adjudicator.
